discourse_list.title: US sanctions tornado cash, risk for Dai?

content.content: I hope this is the right subcategory to post this in. I wanted to hear what the maker community thinks on recent news. Most will probably already be familiar with this. Here is a press release from the treasury:   U.S. Department of the Treasury    U.S. Treasury Sanctions Notorious Virtual Currency Mixer Tornado Cash WASHINGTON – Today, the U.S. Department of the Treasury’s Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) sanctioned virtual currency mixer Tornado Cash, which has been used to launder more than $7 billion worth of virtual currency since its creation in...      They are sanctioning tornado cash because its being used by north korea and others to launder money. What do you think MakerDao should do if they start sanctioning Dai?

They can’t sanction Dai, but they could affect Dai coming from open vaults with collateral in USDC by suspicious wallets, another way would be that suspects use Dai to put it in tornado Cash and thus cause suspicion to the U.E. treasury and they react with a sanction to Maker by freezing part of the 50% backing Dai.
View Proposal for the avoidance of possible future sanctions
